page.title: 02Normanby Hall Country Park-1
page.content: Normanby Park has been owned by the Sheffield family since 1589 and so plays an important part in the local history of the area.In 1703,John Sheffield became a Duke and the titles he chose were"Normanby and the County of Buckingham".In addition to Normanby Hall the Duke of Buckingham built a fine house at Westminster. Through it his title has become a household word,though his"Buckingham House"has undergone several transformations before becoming today's"Buckingham Palace"he having sold"Buckingham House"to George III in 1762.There are some early inventories of Buckingham House in Scunthorpe Museum archives. In 1962 Normanby Park was leased to Scunthorpe Corporation for 99 years at a nominal rent.It attracts visitors from near and far.
